page.title: 17Local Celebrity
page.content:
Joe Corrie - 1894-1968 playwrite, poet and short story writer.
Joe corrie was born in Slammanan in 1894. In 1900 his family moved to Cardenden where his father found work in the local coal mine. At the age of fourteen Joe joined his father at the pit. It aws a hard and often dangerous life. When Joe was 20 his father died, leaving him to support his mother, sister and younger brothers. When World War One started Joe was sent to work in Mossblowen Colliery in Ayrshire. After the war he returned to Cardenden to find no job awaiting him. At this time there was deep unrest in the coal fields due to the post-war resesion, unemployment and poor working conditions. There were strikes in 1920, 1921 and the general strike in 1926. (cont.)
